text:
Hamilton Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Second Avenue. These buildings were later torn down for the construction of Gowanus Parkway, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the Belt Parkway system of highways.

View 2 shows the same corner with the buildings down.

View 1: July 26, 1940
View 2: October 17, 1940

P. L. Sperr

view 3: Neg No. A-969

Hamilton Avenue, at the S.E. corner of Second Avenue. These buildings were later torn down for the construction of Gowanus Parkway, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the Belt Parkway system of highways.

Hamilton Avenue, east side, north from Second Avenue to 15th Street, showing the area after the buildings that stood here were demolished for the widening of the avenue. Gowanus Parkway, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the Belt Parkway, was later constructed here. The gas tank is on 13th Street. View is north from near 14th Street.

View 1: October 17, 1940
View 2: October 23, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Hamilton Avenue, east side, north from Second Avenue to 15th Street, showing the area after the buildings that stood here were demolished for the widening of the avenue. Gowanus Parkway, Brooklyn's northerly extension of the Belt Parkway, was later constructed here. The gas tank is on 13th Street. View is north from near 14th Street.

View 1: October 17, 1940
View 2: October 23, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Hamilton Avenue, at the N. E. corner of 15th Street, showing John M. Kelleher's scrap metal yard. Improvements were later made here when the area became part of the northerly extension of the Belt Parkway. The gas tank is at 13th Street.

July 26, 1940

P. L. Sperr

Views 1-3

Views 2: neg. no. A-956
View 3: neg. no. A-957
